metadata.Title: CVE-2023-3301 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in QEMU. The async nature of hot-unplug enables a racescenario where the net device backend is cleared before the virtio-net pcifrontend has been unplugged. A malicious guest could use this time windowto trigger an assertion and cause a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3301` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu-block-extra - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu3
qemu-guest-agent - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu3
qemu-system - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu3
qemu-system-arm - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu3
qemu-system-common - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu3
qemu-system-data - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu3
qemu-system-gui - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu3
qemu-system-mips - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu3
qemu-system-misc - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu3
qemu-system-ppc - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu3
qemu-system-s390x - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu3
qemu-system-sparc - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu3
qemu-system-x86 - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu3
qemu-system-x86-xen - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu3
qemu-system-xen - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu3
qemu-user - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu3
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu3
qemu-user-static - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu3
qemu-utils - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu3').
